oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nashville Record Review Artist Interviews 1982 - A
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recordings of phone interviews with various artists hosted by Al Rosen. Recording features: Roseanne Cash, Juice Newton, Charley Pride, T. G. Sheppard, Ed Bruce, Bill Golden, Tom Wright, and Lee Greenwood. Item is listed as part A of the 1982 Nashville Radio Review artist interviews.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Al Risen
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Al Risen and Randy Parton discuss Parton's past profession, and Parton discusses his family's influence -- (01:09) Parton discusses why he chose to record "Oh No," and Risen and Parton discuss who influenced Parton's musical career -- (02:13) Parton reflects on how he chooses his music career over a career in television -- (02:46) Risen radio spot introducing "Oh No" -- (02:51) Risen introduces Sylvia, and Sylvia discusses how he had been spending all night recording her album -- (03:28) Sylvia reflects on her upcoming ventures -- (04:32) Sylvia and Risen reflect on the writers of "Sweet Yesterday" -- (05:15) Sylvia discusses her upcoming tour with the Oak Ridge Boys -- (05:53) Risen radio spot introduction for "Drifter" -- (05:56) Risen introduces David Allen Coe, and Coe discusses what his current projects are -- (08:02) Coe and Risen reflect on why Risen chose to live in Key West, Florida instead of Nashville, Tennessee -- (08:42) Coe describes how he came to record "Now Lay Me Down to Cheat" -- (09:23) Risen radio spot introducing "Now Lay Me Down to Cheat" -- (09:30) Risen introduces T. G. Sheppard, and Sheppard reflects on his recent television work -- (10:19) Sheppard and Risen discuss Sheppard's racing interests -- (11:50) Risen and Sheppard reflect on the importance of Fan Fair -- (12:19) Sheppard and Risen reflect on the creation of "Finally," and Sheppard's new album -- (13:35) Risen radio spot introduction to "Finally" -- (13:41) Risen introduces Ronnie McDowell, and McDowell reveals that he had worked on a music video recently -- (14:48) McDowell reflects on his restaurant ventures -- (15:35) McDowell discusses how "Step Back" has been labeled under different genres -- (16:12) Risen and McDowell reflect on the number of songs Risen receives -- (17:26) McDowell's producer, Buddy Killen, is joked about -- (17:56) Risen radio spot introducing "Finally" -- (18:01) Risen introduces Sheppard, and both discuss how he had just returned from Missouri -- (18:37) Sheppard discusses his time on the Today Show -- (19:49) Sheppard reflects on talking to the writers of "War is Hell" -- (21:34) Sheppard reveals his upcoming schedule -- (22:23) Risen radio spot introducing "War is Hell" -- (22:29) Risen introduces Steve Wariner, and both discuss the delays associated with his Wariner's new album -- (23:19) Wariner discusses contributing to the new Chet Atkins album and the upcoming Christmas album -- (24:29) Risen radio spot introducing "Your Memory" -- (24:34) Risen introduces Jeff Cook who discusses Alabama's upcoming album; additionally, Cook discusses the additional staff required to screen music -- (25:28) Cook reveals Alabama's new Christmas song, and Cook and Risen discuss Cook's aspirations to be a saxophone artist -- (26:07) Risen and Cook discuss Cook's new studio aspirations -- (26:24) Risen and Cook reflect on why Alabama chose to record "Close Enough to Perfect," and Cook discusses his free time -- (27:49) Risen radio spot introducing "Close Enough to Perfect -- (27:54) Risen introduces Sylvia, and both discuss the preparation required for the Country Music Association Awards -- (29:24) Sylvia reflects on her recent scheduling issues -- (30:22) Why Sylvia chose "Like Nothing Ever Happened" is discussed -- (31:35) Risen radio spot introducing "Like Nothing Ever Happened"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Risen, Al; Cash, Rosanne; Newton, Juice; Pride, Charley; Pride, Charley, 1938-; Sheppard, T. G.; Bruce, Ed; Golden, William Lee; Wright, Thomas; Greenwood, Lee;
